tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
"No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess and no bold guess was ever made without curiosity"
- Sir Issac Newton

Have you ever wondered why all the stuff around you are as they are and not otherwise? Have you ever asked yourself why something happens the way it does and not otherwise? If so, then this is your cup of tea. After all, everything happens for a reason - SCIENCE. Be part of an event designed to test your ability to decipher the science behind...er...everything.

tabs.title: Format
tabs.content:
The event will have three rounds.

ROUND 1: Written round.

7 teams will be selected for the second round based on their performance.

ROUND 2:

This round will consist of grids from different topics on basic engineering. Each grid will have questions from the particular topic.4 teams will be selected for the next round.

ROUND 3:

Will be announced on spot.

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Team of 4 (Students from different disciplines of engineering are encouraged to form teams).

» The members of a team can be from different colleges/institutions.

» Valid k! ID for each of team members

» Passionately curious people are more welcome.

» Curiosity about the engineering marvels around you and a thirst for knowledge in science will be an added advantage!
